intro: Rotheca taborensis var. taborensis, commonly known as the Taborensis Rotheca, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and daisy-like appearance. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, adapting to the harsh environmental conditions of its native habitat. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers bloom in clusters, often displaying a range of colors from white to pink. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations and limited distribution.
